dqcnac.local_routing.basic_router module

Basic router class module.

class dqcnac.local_routing.basic_router.BasicRouter(coupling_map: CouplingMap, ebits: List[int], initial_layout: Layout, network_to_local: Dict[str, Dict[int, int]], reg_to_node: Dict[Qubit, str], couplings: Dict[str, CouplingMap])[source]

Bases: object

Perform routing of a DAGCircuit with remote gates onto a coupling_map adding swap gates. When a cz is does not comply with the coupling map, insert one or more swaps in front (on the shortest path) to make it compatible.

__init__(coupling_map: CouplingMap, ebits: List[int], initial_layout: Layout, network_to_local: Dict[str, Dict[int, int]], reg_to_node: Dict[Qubit, str], couplings: Dict[str, CouplingMap])[source]

BasicSwap initializer.

Parameters:

  • coupling_map (CouplingMap) – Directed graph represented the coupling map of the network.

  • ebits (list) – list of ebits in the coupling map

  • initial_layout (Layout) – initial layout

  • network_to_local (dict) – dictionary mapping qubits in the network to qubits on the nodes

  • reg_to_node (dict) – dictionary mapping circuit register to nodes

  • couplings (dict) – dictionary mapping nodes to their coupling map

dijkstra_shortest_path(coupling: CouplingMap, initial: int, end: int) → List[int][source]

Use dijkstra algorithm to compute the shortest path between two nodes in a graph

Parameters:

  • coupling – the graph

  • initial – the source node

  • end – the target node

Returns:

the shortest path

distance(local_map: CouplingMap, node: str, p1: int, p2: int) → int[source]

Compute the distance between two qubits in a coupling map

Parameters:

  • local_map – the coupling map

  • node – the network node to which the qubits pertains

  • p1 – the first qubit

  • p2 – the second qubit

Returns:

the distance between the qubits

is_ebit(q: int | Qubit, layout) → bool[source]

Check if a qubit is an ebit

Parameters:

  • q – qubit to check

  • layout – layout of the circuit

Returns:

True if qubit is an ebit, False otherwise

static multi_qubit_ops(dag: DAGCircuit) → List[DAGNode][source]

Get a list of 2 qubit operations. Ignore directives like snapshot and barrier.

Parameters:

dag – the circuit

Returns:

a list of two qubit gates in the circuit

run(dag: DAGCircuit) → Tuple[DAGCircuit, Layout][source]

Inserts swap ro route a circuit on a coupling map

Parameters:

dag – the circuit

Returns:

the routed circuit and the final mapping

shortest_undirected_path(coupling_map: CouplingMap, physical_qubit1: int, physical_qubit2: int) → List[int][source]

Compute the shortest undirected path between two physical qubits

Parameters:

  • coupling_map – the coupling map

  • physical_qubit1 – the first physical qubit

  • physical_qubit2 – the second physical qubit

Returns:

the path from physical qubit1 to physical qubit2
